column4: HELP, how can i install old alsa back, i installed some driver from realtek and now ubuntu can't find my sound card (onboard)
i wouldn't like to reinstall ubuntu :(
did it recognize your sound card before
did ubuntu recognize your card before
yes, before i installed realtek's hda drivers and rebooted :|
i don't know how to since the install doesn't have uninstallation option
have you tried loading the alsa modules manually with modprobe?
and the readme doesn't say anything about uninstalling
no and i have no idea how, i just installed ubuntu yesterday :O
i also tried to search for this problem in ubuntuforums & google but i don't really have any idea what to search for
they were for your hard drive?
what kind of drivers were these? for an HD soundcard?
whats the model # for the card?
00:1b.0 Audio device: Intel Corporation 82801H (ICH8 Family) HD Audio Controller (rev 02)
i dont think this is for your model but take a look at this https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Gutsy_Intel_HD_Audio_Controller
